metadata.description: Pattern interaction ratings, team compositions, and collaboration frameworks

pace.description: Separates fast-acting (D, I) from cautious, reflective (S, C)

priority.description: Separates task-oriented (D, C) from people-oriented (I, S)

diagonal_maximum.description: Maximum tension - opposite on both axes
diagonal_maximum.characteristics: High complementarity but highest friction. Requires most conscious adaptation.

adjacent_moderate.characteristics: Smoothest daily dynamics with moderate complementarity.

same_quadrant.description: Low tension - same quadrant but amplify shared weaknesses
same_quadrant.characteristics: Immediate understanding but risks blind spots.

interaction_model.compatibility_principle: Shared secondary styles (especially I or S) are the strongest predictor of successful collaboration.

Developer_Specialist.summary: Maximum tension. Developer's rapid decisions steamroll Specialist's need for stability.
Developer_Specialist.strengths: Developer drives strategy; Specialist ensures reliable execution.
Developer_Specialist.challenges: Developer sees Specialist as passive; Specialist internalizes resentment.
success_keys: Developer must slow down and explain 'why' behind changes
Specialist must speak up proactively before resentment builds

Promoter_ObjectiveThinker.summary: Diagonal clash. Promoter's enthusiasm collides with Objective Thinker's demand for data.
Promoter_ObjectiveThinker.strengths: Promoter sells vision; Objective Thinker builds specifications.
Promoter_ObjectiveThinker.challenges: Promoter's spontaneity vs C's need for detail.
success_keys: Objective Thinker allows brainstorming without premature criticism

ResultsOriented_Investigator.summary: Surprisingly strong. Investigator's secondary D creates shared respect for results.
ResultsOriented_Investigator.strengths: Investigator's patience and follow-through balances Results-Oriented; C-component adds rigor.
success_keys: Leverage shared D for common ground

Persuader_Perfectionist.summary: Challenging but productive. Exceptional sales-to-delivery pairing.
Persuader_Perfectionist.challenges: Persuader wants quick action; Perfectionist needs thorough analysis.
success_keys: Perfectionist provides clear timelines rather than open-ended delays

Inspirational_Practitioner.summary: Both share I-components, providing social comfort.
Inspirational_Practitioner.strengths: Inspirational provides vision; Practitioner ensures quality implementation with human touch.
success_keys: Practitioner's warmth makes them receptive to Inspirational's boldness

Creative_Agent.summary: Diagonal opposites softened by secondary styles.
Creative_Agent.strengths: Creative generates well-researched ideas; Agent provides friendly implementation and stakeholder management.
Creative_Agent.challenges: Creative's intensity may overwhelm Agent's preference for harmony.

D_family.strength: Fast alignment on action and goals
D_family.risk: Power struggles; too many cooks; no one handles details
D_family.worst_pairing: Developer + Developer (2.0) - parallel decision-making, competing agendas

I_family.risk: Lack of follow-through; over-promising; insufficient detail work

S_family.risk: Resistance to change; slow decisions; conflict avoidance
S_family.best_pairing: Specialist + Agent (4.5) - deeply harmonious but risks passivity

C_family.risk: Analysis paralysis; nothing ships; social disconnection

execution_operations.mission: Reliable execution, process excellence, scalable operations

roles.rationale: Reliable with drive to push performance

customer_service.mission: Customer satisfaction, relationship building, problem resolution

creative_marketing.mission: Brand building, creative campaigns, audience engagement

technical_engineering.mission: Product development, technical excellence, system architecture

pairings.mitigation: Developer must slow communication; Specialist must voice concerns early
Promoter provides written details; Objective Thinker accepts verbal brainstorming
Results-Oriented allows time for quality; Perfectionist commits to deadlines

smooth_reporting.description: Natural reporting relationships with lower friction

pairings.reason: Shared I creates natural bridge; leader-supporter dynamic
Both S-primary; shared values of reliability and consistency
Both value quality and analytical rigor

team_balance_principles.quadrant_representation: Most effective teams include representation from all four quadrants (D/I/S/C)

homogeneous_risks.all_D: Teams fight for control, no detail work gets done
homogeneous_risks.all_I: Teams over-promise and under-deliver, lack follow-through
homogeneous_risks.all_S: Teams stall on decisions, resist necessary change
homogeneous_risks.all_C: Teams suffer analysis paralysis, perfectionism prevents shipping

team_balance_principles.productive_tension: Best teams engineer productive tension rather than avoiding it. Diagonal pairs (D-S, I-C) offer highest growth potential with managed friction.
